name: Inn at the Harbour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For a bed just steps from the lakefront, you could not get a better price. After some discussion, we paid $129.00 for a king size bed overlooking the water. There were chairs on the 2nd. floor balcony to enjoy the view, but it was rainy and cool.
reviews.title: Wonderful location, average motel room

reviews.text: The room was nothing out of the ordinary but clean. Bed was comfortable. If I was to nitpick, I would complain that the pillows were stuffed too much making for a lot of pillow punching to get a good spot.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: We walked along the beach, very nicely laid out, then turned up to main street and found Tramonto restaurant, owned and operated by the same family as the Inn. Then just a short walk back to the Inn. Great location.
reviews.title: old section not a place to return to

reviews.text: We visited in August. Owners and staff were very friendly and the hotel was very clean. They are renovating to expand, but this did not affect our stay at all, it was quiet and relaxing, exactly what we were looking for.
reviews.title: Brand New Section Open Now

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a room on the main level of the old section. It had a portable air conditioner in the window that was so noisy we had to turn it off to sleep. Unfortunately the window didn't open, so the room was unbearably hot.
reviews.title: Will come back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Throughout the years we have stayed here on many occassions primarily due to the fantastic location (close to the main beach and walking distance to all amenities). We could not believe the difference for this visit - the new owners have done a fantastic job revovating the rooms - the old spingy beds have been replaced with fabulous new ones, the room decore has been upgraded, the place was clean and definitely showed pride of ownership. We would stay here again on our next trip to Kincardine.
reviews.title: Hats off to the newest owners

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good locations, large room, best mattress in a motel I have ever slept on. Only thing missing was a microwave
reviews.title: Spacious, cleanliness, comfortable beds!!

reviews.text: I stayed there last nite by myself and was very happy with it. I was on the bottom level, which was fine. There are 9 units in all, on 2 floors. Outdoor access only.
reviews.title: Nice place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was really comfy, which I was thankful for, most motel/hotel beds are hard but this one was very plush. Lots of blankets and clean, too. The electric heater for the unit worked well.
reviews.title: Best spot in town

reviews.text: The bathroom was nice, lots of towels, everything was clean. Small fridge/freezer but no microwave. I had an end unit so there were two big windows. I slept well, which I dont usually do in motels/hotels. The staff were very nice and gave me a price break as a solo traveler :-)
reviews.title: Great Location!

likes.liked: — The location to beach, marina and restaurants

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is fantastic - everything is within walking distance, so you just park your car and go. The rooms are updated and clean. Beds are very comfortable The view of the harbour is amazing. I have stayed here many times over the years, and each year there are more evident improvements over the last. You can tell that the owners take pride in their business - cannot wait to see the additional units that are being added. See you next year!
reviews.title: Best place to stay in town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thanks to TripAdvisor reviews , we enjoyed a pleasant apartment and nice view of The Kincardine Harbor, Light House Museum and Lake Huron.
reviews.title: Surprising In in Surprising Town

reviews.text: We called ahead and asked for a top floor, king room with a harbor/Lake view. When we arrived Jen , one of the Owners, told us the room with the best view was not available, but we could have the one bedroom apartment for the same price. The apartment is on the second floor of a small house across the street, overlooking the river with a closer view of the marina and Lake Huron than the Inn room would may have had. The apartment is very nicely appointed with a well supplied kitchen. It is spacious with views from every living space and bedroom window. The bed is very comfortable.I was surprised the couch appeared to not be a pull out bed. The only minor concern is the condition of the stairway going upstairs. It is a little wobbly. I'm sure it's safe, but I would prefer a more stable structure.
reviews.title: I've been here 5 minutes and I love it!!!

reviews.text: The Inn is undergoing major construction and renovation. A building next door has been acquired and is being brought up to code. It will be 3 floors and a first floor breakfast room. When that addition is complete, the original part of the Inn will be renovated. Judging from the apartment, I assume these will be very nice accommodations. The floors will be sound proof.
reviews.title: The best location to experience Kincardine

reviews.text: Kincardine is a beautiful town on the Lake Huron Eastern Bank. We will definitely stay here again when we have more time to explore the area.It appeared to be the only hotel near the Lake and we walked to dinner easily.
reviews.title: Wonderful location!

reviews.text: I chose this hotel for the location near the harbor and in the middle of town. I was only there for 1 night, but wished I could have stayed longer. My room was in the older building of the hotel, which is an old-style motel with parking in front and exterior corridors. The building is older, so you don't have the same sound-proofing, large bathrooms, etc. that you would expect in a newer building. Still, the room was very comfortable and well-maintained. The bed was very comfortable. It appears that the rooms have been recently updated.
reviews.title: Great location, comfortable hotel

reviews.text: Expensive for basic accommodation.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms on the lower level have no harbour view.
reviews.title: great time at Inn at the Harbour

reviews.text: Our room had ill fitting blinds on the window. Plumbing was noisy. We could hear other visitors showering and toilets flushing.
reviews.title: Wow

reviews.text: The coffee in the room was undrinkable.
reviews.title: Was good

description: The Harbour Motor Inn is Kincardine's pre-eminent waterfront destination, right across from the Kincardine Lighthouse and the historic Walker House. We offer clean, beautifully furnished rooms with glorious views of Lake Huron sunsets and 2 minute walking access to the harbour, beaches, restaurants and Kincardine's main street. NEW ROOMS OPENING IN 2012.
